feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" computes daily-rate based salary amounts based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Evidence connects this to unpaid leave deductions. Calculations may use either calendar or working days depending on configuration. Global payroll settings can override policy-level settings. UI/display mismatches reported in tickets. Recalculation gaps where changes do not retroactively update results. Customers request greater configurability and transparency.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Daily Wage Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is not active. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for daily wage calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists between leave policy and payroll modules for daily wage formula configuration.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Counting in EOS Gratuity Calculator
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years, specifically for 2024. This results in an inaccurate total service period and lower gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation shows slight differences from manual calculations due to complex service duration and daily wage formula
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves tiered rates (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year after) and prorated calculations for partial years
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation logic requires precise understanding of service duration split and daily wage computation

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Leap Year Handling
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing slight discrepancies in total service days calculation. The specific issue involves whether the extra day in a leap year (92 vs 93 days in 2024) impacts the total service duration calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Worked in Gratuity Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates days worked with a potential extra day, causing slight variations in gratuity calculation (622 vs 623 days). The platform captures 623 days instead of the expected 622 days when computing length of service.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked calculation method
known_issues.gap_statement: Precision in days calculation needs review to ensure exact service duration computation

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The daily wage is divided according to policy settings (potentially 30 vs 31 days), causing potential salary amount mismatches.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly working days variation impacts leave salary accrual consistency
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months with varying working days.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Calculation Divisors
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses different divisors for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. This leads to inconsistent daily wage calculations between leave salary and salary proration scenarios.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use independent daily wage configurations with different divisors, preventing automatic alignment of calculation methods.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Salary proration depends entirely on work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration logic only works for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: The daily wage calculator lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions on Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, there is a timing mismatch between Time Off and Payroll modules causing incorrect daily wage calculations. The system cannot recalculate deductions retroactively, leading to inconsistent salary deduction amounts.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for module communication enhancement to send complete leave request details between Time Off and Payroll modules to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Method
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculated by dividing monthly salary by 30.42 (not calendar days), potentially resulting in deductions that exceed expected monthly salary
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in remarks for February unpaid leave deduction, despite accurate backend calculation. The actual deduction calculation remains mathematically correct.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Global daily rate configuration overrides policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods. The system calculates deductions using a global daily rate instead of the configured policy-level method (Basic Salary / Working Days), potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically supersede individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods.
known_issues.gap_statement: Current system lacks transparency in configuration hierarchy and prevents policy-level customization of leave deduction calculations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Display Across Payroll Months
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month of leave.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate recalculated based on payroll processing month rather than stored from leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month (365 annual days - 52 weekly offs = 313 working days / 12 months = 26.08 days)
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for variations in actual worked days

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll settings for daily wage calculator automatically override leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations.
limitations.impact: Users cannot directly modify the daily wage formula in leave policy when payroll settings are configured

limitations.title: Salary Configuration Dependency in Leave Deduction
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or updated with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years during service period calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service gratuity benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision in Daily Wage Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations (basic + allowances / 30) consistently produce amounts slightly lower than expected due to decimal handling.
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies in end of service settlements

limitations.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Accrual Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Monthly accrual policy prevents automatic inclusion of leave days for incomplete months during employee departure
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month do not automatically receive prorated leave balance in End of Service (EOS) calculation

limitations.title: Days to Years Conversion Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Service duration is calculated by dividing total days by 365, which may not precisely account for leap years or partial years
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations for service periods spanning leap years

limitations.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Rigid Daily Rate Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform's leave salary calculation uses a fixed divisor from policy configuration, which cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify the daily wage calculation method to account for unique monthly variations or specific employee circumstances.

limitations.title: Working Days vs Custom Days Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment calculations can be set to either 'working days' or 'custom days', which significantly impacts accrual reporting
limitations.impact: Monthly leave salary accruals will vary based on the number of working days in each month

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using separate daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically synchronized.
limitations.impact: Potential discrepancies in salary calculations between leave periods and regular salary proration

limitations.title: Proration Based on Work Week Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration calculates based on the specific work week configuration, which can result in full month calculation if all 7 days are marked as working days
limitations.impact: Proration will use all configured working days, even if this means a full 31-day month for some work week configurations

limitations.title: Limited Proration Date Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is only accurate when departure dates are in the past, creating inconsistent calculations for future-dated departures
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inability to Automatically Reconcile Leave Transactions
limitations.limitation_statement: When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
limitations.impact: Users must manually remove duplicate or incorrect payroll deductions after leave request modifications

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.
limitations.impact: Salary deductions for unpaid leave depend on precise working days calculation

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which differs from calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may not precisely match expected monthly salary

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations are based on calendar days, with specific handling required for months with varying days (especially February in leap years).
limitations.impact: Potential confusion in unpaid leave deduction remarks, though core calculation remains accurate

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations.
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists.

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate calculated as Basic + Allowances / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Worked in Gratuity Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates days worked with a potential extra day, causing slight variations in gratuity calculation (622 vs 623 days). The platform captures 623 days instead of the expected 622 days when computing length of service.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The daily wage is divided according to policy settings (potentially 30 vs 31 days), causing potential salary amount mismatches.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Calculation Divisors
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses different divisors for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. This leads to inconsistent daily wage calculations between leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions on Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, there is a timing mismatch between Time Off and Payroll modules causing incorrect daily wage calculations. The system cannot recalculate deductions retroactively, leading to inconsistent salary deduction amounts.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in remarks for February unpaid leave deduction, despite accurate backend calculation. The actual deduction calculation remains mathematically correct.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Global daily rate configuration overrides policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods. The system calculates deductions using a global daily rate instead of the configured policy-level method (Basic Salary / Working Days), potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Display Across Payroll Months
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month of leave.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month (365 annual days - 52 weekly offs = 313 working days / 12 months = 26.08 days)

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll settings for daily wage calculator automatically override leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Configuration Dependency in Leave Deduction
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deductions are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years during service period calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision in Daily Wage Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations (basic + allowances / 30) consistently produce amounts slightly lower than expected due to decimal handling.

claims_to_validate.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Accrual Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Monthly accrual policy prevents automatic inclusion of leave days for incomplete months during employee departure

claims_to_validate.title: Days to Years Conversion Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Service duration is calculated by dividing total days by 365, which may not precisely account for leap years or partial years

claims_to_validate.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Rigid Daily Rate Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform's leave salary calculation uses a fixed divisor from policy configuration, which cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.

claims_to_validate.title: Working Days vs Custom Days Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment calculations can be set to either 'working days' or 'custom days', which significantly impacts accrual reporting

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using separate daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically synchronized.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Based on Work Week Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration calculates based on the specific work week configuration, which can result in full month calculation if all 7 days are marked as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Limited Proration Date Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is only accurate when departure dates are in the past, creating inconsistent calculations for future-dated departures

claims_to_validate.title: Inability to Automatically Reconcile Leave Transactions
claims_to_validate.statement: When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.

claims_to_validate.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations are based on calendar days, with specific handling required for months with varying days (especially February in leap years).

claims_to_validate.statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations.
